text: Vestland is a county in Norway that was created on 1 January 2020. The county is located in Western Norway and it is centred around the city of Bergen. History: The island Selja (in Stad) has ruins of the monastery Selje kloster; It was built in the 12th century; It became the first bishopry in Norway; The bishopry was moved to Bergen (1170).https://snl.no/Stad_-_kommune. SNL.no. Retrieved 2024-07-03 ==References== Category:2020 establishments in Norway
title: Vestland
